Key Match Events: Cubs center fielder Pete Crow-Armstrong made a significant defensive play by cutting off Jose Tena’s line drive and throwing him out at second base.
CJ Abrams, who has 27 stolen bases, was thrown out by catcher Christian Bethancourt while attempting to steal second base.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Craig Counsell praised the defensive efforts of Pete Crow-Armstrong and Christian Bethancourt, highlighting their plays as crucial in getting starter Javier Assad through the sixth inning.
